metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1473 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The ADDW macro in stdio-common/vfscanf.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc orlibc6) before 2.21 does not properly consider data-type size during arisk-management decision for use of the alloca function, which might allowcontext-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentationviolation) or overwrite memory locations beyond the stack boundary via along line containing wide characters that are improperly handled in awscanf call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1473` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.6').
